data.text:
Bert Berns had an influence on popular music of the day, that has been said to be tremendous.

Worked at musical gaints the Brill Building & Atlantic Records; as well as being a co-founder of Bang Records & Shout Records.

Writing many classic tunes; as well as producing sounds that influence music today.

I'm a little late to the party, but are your Bert Berns tracks in mono? It's hard to find those blistering Freddie Scott tunes and excellent Solomon Burke material from that era in mono. The stereo versions really lack the "oomph" of the mono originals.

Freddie Scott's "Are You Lonely For Me" is in mono on the Beg, Scream & Shot box from Rhino (Out of print, but not hard to find), alongside mono versions of Garnet Mimms' "Cry to Me" and Erma Franklin's "Piece of My Heart".

You can find mono Solomon Burke on the 1998 Rhino compilation "The Very Best of Solomon Burke". I believe that five of the tracks are Bert Berns collaborations.

You can also find The Exciters second long player in mono (their one and only for Roulette) on a S/T Warner Japan CD from 2014 [WPCR-27796], which has three Berns tracks. Their Bang recordings are on an Ace CD called "Soul Motion".

Berns' four Lulu collaborations are in mono on her 2009 comp, "Shout! The Complete Decca Recordings" from Cherry Red/RPM.

Here's Jill Jackson, of Paul & Paula fame, doing a take on the arrangement Berns & Co. gave to Lulu.

Thanks. From the album "The Very Best of Solomon Burke" I have made a download of 4 mono songs. Unfortunately I have not found the possibility of downloads from "Beg, Scream & Shot" and "Shout! The Complete Decca Recordings".
